alert.note: Alert for Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 12:27PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central South Dakota, including the following county, Tripp. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 127 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Willow Creek, Deer Creek, Holt Creek, Keya Paha River, Buffalo Creek, Shadley Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Ponca Creek, Sand Creek, Lost Creek, Jimmie Creek and Lute Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Millboro, Keyapaha, Wewela, Clearfield, Dog Ear Lake and southeastern Rosebud Reservation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
